resources.id: [concat(resourceId('Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/providers', parameters('workspace'), 'Microsoft.SecurityInsights'),'/alertRules/', guid('Brute force attack against user credentials (Uses Authentication Normalization)'))]
resources.name: [concat(parameters('workspace'),'/Microsoft.SecurityInsights/', guid('Brute force attack against user credentials (Uses Authentication Normalization)'))]

properties.displayName: [Public]Brute force attack against user credentials (Uses Authentication Normalization)
properties.description: Identifies evidence of brute force activity against a user highlighting multiple authentication failures and by a successful authentication within a given time window. (The query does not enforce any sequence - eg requiring the successful authentication to occur last.) Default Failure count is 10, Default Success count is 1 and default Time Window is 20 minutes. To use this analytics rule, make sure you have deployed the [ASIM normalization parsers](https://aka.ms/AzSentinelAuthentication)
properties.query: let failureCountThreshold = 10; let successCountThreshold = 1; let authenticationWindow = 20m; imAuthentication | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), IPAddress = make_set(SrcDvcIpAddr), FailureCount = countif(EventResult=='Failure'), SuccessCount = countif(EventResult=='Success') by bin(TimeGenerated, authenticationWindow), TargetUserId, TargetUsername, TargetUserType | where FailureCount >= failureCountThreshold and SuccessCount >= successCountThreshold
